intro: Carapichea patrisii, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types. Its ornamental value has led to its introduction in other parts of the world, where it can become invasive.
